content.value_statement: Writing page layouts in Next.js can lead to inconsistent project structure and difficult-to-maintain code. This skill provides clear guidelines for creating modular, well-organized page layouts following Next.js best practices.
actual_capabilities: Generates clean, modular page layouts for Next.js app directory
Enforces 40-line maximum per file for maintainable code
Separates TypeScript types and interfaces to dedicated files
Follows Next.js conventions for page structure
limitations: Only provides guidance for Next.js page layouts
Does not generate full application code
Limited to standard Next.js patterns and conventions
Cannot create complex nested layouts or advanced routing

output_examples.input: Create a page layout for a user profile page
output_examples.output: A modular page.tsx file under 40 lines that imports types from the types directory and follows Next.js conventions.
A clean, minimal page.tsx file with the page component and basic metadata export, keeping all types separate.

best_practices: Keep page layouts under 40 lines for better readability and maintainability
Extract all types and interfaces to a separate types file in src/app/types
Follow Next.js app directory conventions for component organization
anti_patterns: Putting all types and interfaces directly in the page file
Creating page layouts exceeding 40 lines without clear modularization
Mixing business logic with presentation components in page files

faq.question: What does this skill actually do?
faq.answer: This skill provides instructions and guidelines for writing well-structured page layouts in Next.js. It does not generate code or execute commands.

faq.question: Do I need coding experience to use this skill?
faq.answer: Basic familiarity with Next.js and TypeScript is recommended to apply the guidelines effectively.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides guidance through prompts. It does not read, write, or modify any files.

faq.question: Can I use this with plain JavaScript?
faq.answer: The guidelines focus on TypeScript patterns. For JavaScript projects, adapt the type separation guidance as needed.

faq.question: What is the 40-line limit recommendation?
faq.answer: This is a guideline to encourage modular design. Complex pages may need more lines but should remain well-organized.

faq.question: Does this work with the Pages Router?
faq.answer: The skill targets the App Router structure (page.tsx files). For Pages Router, similar principles apply but adapt to pages/index.js patterns.
